pullRequest.body:
This does three things:
* `MultilinearMap.fromDirectSumEquiv` (in `LinearAlgebra/MultilinearMap/DirectSum.lean`) calculates `MultilinearMap`s on a family of `DirectSum`s. More precisely, if `ι` is a `Fintype`, if `κ i` is a family of types indexed by `ι` and we have a `R`-module `M i j` for every `i : ι` and `j : κ i`, this is the linear equivalence between `Π p : (i : ι) → κ i, MultilinearMap R (fun i ↦ M i (p i)) M'` and `MultilinearMap R (fun i ↦ ⨁ j : κ i, M i j) M'`.
* `PiTensorProduct.directSum` (in `LinearAlgebra/DirectSum/PiTensorProduct.lean`): the distributivity property of a `PiTensorProduct` with respect to `DirectSum`s in all its arguments.
* `finsuppPiTensorProduct` (in `LinearAlgebra/DirectSum/Finsupp.lean`): If `ι` is a `Fintype`, `κ i` is a family of types indexed by `ι` and `M i` is a family of `R`-modules indexed by `ι`, then the tensor product of the family `κ i →₀ M i` is linearly equivalent to `∏ i, κ i →₀ ⨂[R] i, M i`.


- [x] depends on: #11152
- [x] depends on: #11196
- [x] depends on: #17881
- [x] depends on: #17932

Some stylistic comments below
Some stylistic comments below

```suggestion
theorem finsuppPiTensorProduct_tprod_single (p : (i : ι) → κ i) (m : (i : ι) → M i) :
```

```suggestion
theorem finsuppPiTensorProduct_symm_single_tprod (p : (i : ι) → κ i) (m : (i : ι) → M i) :
```
I guess this depends on #11196
Yes. I added the `blocked` label.

Note that the style has now changed to omit these extra blank lines; it was only ever a result of `mathport` anyway.
```suggestion
variable (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R]
variable {ι : Type*}
variable [Fintype ι]
variable [DecidableEq ι]
variable (κ : ι → Type*) [(i : ι) → DecidableEq (κ i)]
variable (M : ι → Type*)
variable [∀ i, AddCommMonoid (M i)]
variable [∀ i, Module R (M i)]
variable [(i : ι) → (x : M i) → Decidable (x ≠ 0)]
```
Here too
Ok. I think I found all extra blank lines between variables (I also fixed the proof that wasn;'t working anymore).

Does this not work?
```suggestion
  (PiTensorProduct.directSum R (fun (i : ι) (_ : κ i) ↦ M i)) ≪≫ₗ
```
Can we move this block out of the `rw`? It's pretty hard to read this way

```suggestion
variable [Π i (j : κ i) (x : M i j), Decidable (x ≠ 0)]
```

```suggestion
  by_cases h : j = i
```

```suggestion
    (x : Π i, ⨁ (j : κ i), M i j) :
    fromDirectSum R κ f x =
      ∑ p in Fintype.piFinset (fun i ↦ (x i).support), f p (fun i ↦ x i (p i)) :=
  rfl
```

```suggestion
open DirectSum LinearMap Function
```

```suggestion
    (x : Π i, ⨁ (j : κ i), M i j) :
    fromDirectSumₗ R κ f x =
      ∑ p in Fintype.piFinset (fun i ↦ (x i).support), f p (fun i ↦ x i (p i)) :=
  rfl
```

```suggestion
    simp only [DirectSum.lof_eq_of]
```
Should this be in the `Fintype` namespace?
I deleted this lemma: really it's just `support_lof` / `support_of`, and it wasn't needed after my refactor.

```suggestion
    (x : Π i, ⨁ (j : κ i), M i j) :
    fromDirectSumEquiv R κ f x =
      ∑ p in Fintype.piFinset (fun i ↦ (x i).support), f p (fun i ↦ x i (p i)) :=
  rfl
```

```suggestion
    (p : Π i, κ i) :
    (fromDirectSumEquiv R κ).symm f p = f.compLinearMap (fun i ↦ DirectSum.lof R (κ i) _ (p i)) :=
  rfl
```

I think there's another direct sum hiding here; I've created #17881 with the DFinsupp version.

This then becomes a sum over the support.

Turns out this needs #17932 too. I'm working in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/eric-wieser/SM.PiTensorProduct.DirectSum on the union of these PRs (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/SM.PiTensorProduct.DirectSum...eric-wieser/SM.PiTensorProduct.DirectSum)
I've pushed this refactor,
After #18308, this become a one-line proof using the `DFinsupp` result.

These `erw`s are my fault, and are because we are abusing defeq by using `MultilinearMap.dfinsuppFamilyₗ` instead of duplicating the construction for `directSum`. Probably we should spin out a PR to do that, where all the defs and lemmas are one-liners in terms of the `dfinsupp` versions.

Another good lemma to have here would be
```
@[simp]
theorem fromDirectSumEquiv_single
    (p : Π i, κ i) (f : MultilinearMap R (fun i ↦ M i (p i)) M')
    (i : ι) (j : κ i) (x : M i j) :
    fromDirectSumEquiv R κ (Pi.single p f) =
      f.compLinearMap fun i => DirectSum.component R _ _ (p i) := by
```
#18566 probably helps with such results.
